meanings.definition: A person who approaches strangers asking for money or food.
meanings.sent1: The panhandlers on the corner were asking for spare change.
meanings.sent2: Many panhandlers can be seen downtown asking for help.
meanings.sent3: The panhandlers outside the store were quite persistent in their requests.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were filled with panhandlers seeking assistance.
meanings.sent5: The image of the panhandlers stayed with me long after I left the city.

meanings.definition: The act of begging for money or food on the street.
meanings.sent1: I witnessed the panhandlers outside the subway station every morning.
meanings.sent2: Panhandlers often rely on the generosity of passersby to survive.
meanings.sent3: The panhandlers' signs had a touch of humor, despite their situation.
meanings.sent4: The streets echoed with the sounds of panhandlers calling out for help.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the panhandlers tugged at my heartstrings as I walked by.
